DOC.brief_title: Novel Treatments Enhance Smoking Cessation Before Cancer Surgery : Effects Smoking Surgical Outcomes
DOC.detailed_description: Participants recruit Thoracic Oncology Program Head Neck Cancers Program . At time initial surgical consultation , surgeon support staff Thoracic Oncology Program Head Neck Cancers Program advise patient present smoke cessation study well Smoking Cessation Service Smilow Cancer Hospital/Yale-New Haven Hospital resource community . Patients express interest study agree quit smoking meet Smilow/YNHH intake appointment research assistant . Informed consent obtain prior procedure , intake session medical tobacco use history breath carbon monoxide ( CO ) level obtain participant . Study eligibility determine concert surgeon principal investigator . As agreed upon surgeon , participant meet eligibility criterion , surgery schedule approximately 3 week enter study . Eligible participant randomize either : 1 ) standard care ( i.e. , 4 counseling session NRT ) 2 ) standard care + contingency management ( i.e. , 4 counseling session NRT + 3x/week meeting positive reinforcer ) . After , subject meet study therapist first counsel session , preparation quit session . The study counsel protocol base practical counseling , cognitive behavioral evidence base smoke cessation treatment modality ( Fiore , Ja√©n et al . 2008 ) . All participant ask set quit date within week session . Consistent standard practice Smoking Cessation Service , patient receive pharmacotherapy conjunction counseling .
